'Electric catfish' is the common name for the catfish (order Siluriformes)
family 'Malapteruridae'. This family includes two genera, [[Malapterurus]] and
[[Paradoxoglanis]] with 19 species. Several species
of this family have the ability to produce an electric shock of up to 350 volts
using electroplaques of an electric organ. Electric catfish are
found in tropical Africa and the Nile River. Electric
catfish are usually nocturnal and feed primarily on other fish, incapacitating
their prey with electric discharges. They can grow up to 39
inches long.
